description: Comprehensive sustainability guidelines for product evaluation across all categories - SICOSI System - Brazilian Market Focus
source: Based on ISO standards, EU ESPR, EMBRAPA guidelines, Brazilian certifications, and global sustainability standards

guidelines: Modular design for easy component replacement
Availability of spare parts for at least 7 years
Software updates support for minimum 5 years
Standardized screws and fasteners (no proprietary tools)
Clearly marked plastic types for recycling
Reduced use of rare earth metals
Reduced chemical dyes (natural or low-impact dyes)
Local or regional production to reduce transport emissions
Protection of natural habitats (Amazon, Cerrado, Mata Atlântica)
Fair wages for farmers and workers
Meets safety standards (EN71, ASTM F963, INMETRO)
No small parts for young children
Meets medical device regulations (ANVISA, FDA, CE)

digital_products_software.name: Digital Products & Software

guidelines: Optimized code for low energy consumption
Edge computing to reduce data transfer
Data centers powered by renewable energy

references: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

ai_ml_concerns: Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT consume significant energy
Training a single large AI model can emit as much CO2 as 5 cars over their lifetime
Prefer smaller, specialized models over general-purpose large models
Use model compression and quantization techniques
Consider federated learning to reduce centralized computing
blockchain_concerns: Prefer Proof-of-Stake or other efficient consensus mechanisms
Consider environmental impact of cryptocurrency mining
streaming_concerns: Video streaming accounts for significant internet traffic and energy
Optimize video quality based on device and network

cloud_services.name: Cloud Services & Data Centers
references: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

guidelines: Sustainable protein sources (insect protein, upcycled ingredients)
Biodegradable materials for toys and accessories
Natural fibers for beds and toys
Reusable products preferred (cloth diapers, menstrual cups)

carbon_footprint: Measure and reduce greenhouse gas emissions
Carbon offset programs for unavoidable emissions

brazilian_certifications.INMETRO: Brazilian product quality and safety certification
brazilian_certifications.I-REC: International Renewable Energy Certificate (used in Brazil)

evaluation_methodology.description: How to use these guidelines for product evaluation
steps: 1. Extract product information from user context (text selection, page title, URL)
2. Use web search to gather additional product details
3. Identify the most relevant product category based on keywords (fuzzy matching)
4. Apply category-specific sustainability criteria with their weights
5. Check for recognized certifications mentioned (international and Brazilian)
7. Use Groq LLM to analyze and score the product intelligently
8. Search for sustainable alternatives in the same category

scoring.excellent: 90-100: Meets > 80% of criteria with relevant certifications - Highly sustainable
scoring.good: 70-89: Meets 60-80% of criteria - Good sustainability performance
scoring.poor: 0-49: Meets < 40% of criteria - Low sustainability, alternatives strongly recommended

evaluation_methodology.llm_prompt_template: Analyze this product: {product_name}. Category: {category}. Context: {context}. Evaluate against these sustainability criteria: {criteria}. Check for certifications: {certifications}. Consider Brazilian context. Provide: 1) Sustainability score (0-100), 2) Strengths, 3) Weaknesses, 4) Three sustainable alternatives (prioritize Brazilian brands) with justification.

metadata.coverage: Comprehensive - physical products, digital products, services, Brazilian market focus
standards_referenced: ESPR - Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation
TCFD - Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures

special_focus.digital_sustainability: Includes guidelines for software, AI/ML, cloud services, and data centers - addressing energy consumption of LLMs and blockchain
special_focus.embrapa_integration: Forest products guidelines extended from EMBRAPA SICOSIFlorestas document
special_focus.dynamic_evaluation: System uses LLM to understand context and apply guidelines intelligently, not hardcoded product matching
special_focus.brazilian_market: Prioritizes Brazilian brands, certifications, and bioeconomy products
special_focus.pet_care_focus: Comprehensive pet care category addressing major market gap
special_focus.water_conservation: Critical for Brazilian water scarcity regions
special_focus.circular_economy: Sharing economy and repair services integrated
